conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C. Predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.

B is the starting point of the liquid.
C is the starting point of the liquid.
D and E are the containers that receive the liquid.

conclusion: Liquid from A flows into container D.

premise: Stream B falls on the black baffle and is deflected to the right.

premise: Stream C falls straight down without meeting any obstacles.
conclusion: Liquid from C flows into container E.

premise: Liquid from A flows into container D; Liquid from B and C flows into container E.
conclusion: The liquid from A will flow into container D, and the liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
